hint.text:
If the base on both sides of the equation are equal, the exponents can be evaluated with each other.
\(a^m \times a^n=a^{m+n}\)

solution.text:
\((2^{m+1} \times 2^2) = 16\)
\(\Rightarrow2^{m+1} \times 2^2 = 2^4\)
\(\Rightarrow2^{m+3} = 2^4\,\)[Using identity \(a^m \times a^n=a^{m+n}\)]
Equating the powers of both sides as the base is the same,
\(\Rightarrow m+3=4\)
\(\Rightarrow m=1\)
